plants.name: Crocus vernus
plants.description: A perennial bulbous plant known for its early spring blooms, crocuses often emerge through snow and flower in late winter to early spring. They have cup-shaped flowers and grass-like leaves.
plants.funFact: Crocuses are among the first flowers to bloom in spring, symbolizing cheerfulness and youth.

plants.name: Prunus persica
plants.description: Peach trees produce delicate pink flowers early in the year, often before the leaves emerge, heralding the start of spring. These blossoms are admired for their beauty and fragrant scent.
plants.location: East Asia, Mediterranean, Southern United States
plants.funFact: Peach blossoms are significant in Chinese culture, symbolizing longevity and prosperity.

plants.name: Acacia dealbata
plants.description: This fast-growing evergreen tree blooms profusely with bright yellow fluffy flower clusters in late winter and early spring, often used in floral arrangements.
plants.funFact: Mimosa flowers are used to celebrate International Women's Day in some countries due to their vibrant and cheerful color.

plants.name: Nerium oleander
plants.description: Oleander is an evergreen shrub that blooms from spring through fall in warmer climates, including late winter in subtropical areas. It produces large, fragrant, and showy flowers.
plants.funFact: Oleander is highly toxic if ingested but widely cultivated for its beauty and drought tolerance.
